tweet: In a few moments, @GovernorBullock and I will be answering your questions live on Facebook—join the conversation here: https://t.co/g9XpFj5R1k

Where you live shouldn't determine how well you stay connected. Rural America has been without reliable broadband for too long—as more folks are learning, working, and receiving health care online than ever, we’ve got to close the digital divide.
https://t.co/pLOh9pnxqu

Got questions? @GovernorBullock and I have answers. We'll be teaming up today at 12:30pm MT for a live Q&A. Tune in for an update on Montana's next steps in navigating the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/g9XpFj5R1k

Montana ranchers have seen their margins drop as large-scale packers manipulate cattle prices. My bipartisan #RancherReliefPlan requires large packers to buy half their cattle on the cash market—giving producers more negotiating power and increasing transparency in the market. https://t.co/J5uuADGGzg

Head Start continues to make a big difference in the lives of Montana kids by building a strong foundation for learning and providing families with the tools they need to support our next generation of leaders. 

Happy birthday @HeadStartgov—55 years looks good on you.

Since day one, @GovernorBullock and I have been working to ensure Montana makes it safely to the other side of the COVID-19 crisis. As MT's phased reopening begins, we know folks have a lot of questions—we’re here to help. Join us Wednesday, May 20 at 12:30MT for a live Q&A. https://t.co/NBNQRrtttF
Look, @timkaine, you saw what I did to @SenBooker on the basketball court—don’t make me put you down too. https://t.co/r96no6ilGZ https://t.co/ZCXeubnyNs

The Coronavirus Food Assistance Program will provide $16 billion to ag producers who have suffered losses due to the COVID-19 pandemic. @USDA will be accepting applications for relief soon—producers can take these steps to ensure they are prepared now. https://t.co/a0C8kvn2Hm https://t.co/GeVgk0GB0R

As we honor #NationalPeaceOfficersMemorialDay, we recognize the courage and sacrifice of Montana's brave law enforcement officers putting their lives on the line to keep us safe, and especially those we have lost in the line of duty. Thank you.

Part 3 of the #RancherReliefPlan:

Giving USA producers back their competitive edge and providing consumers more transparency on the food that fuels them by requiring mandatory Country of Origin Labeling on all beef products sold in the US. https://t.co/L4LdPCEoii

Part 2 of the #RancherReliefPlan:

Increasing transparency in the marketplace by requiring packers to purchase 50% of their cattle via cash, or “spot,” payments, giving ranchers more opportunity to negotiate fair returns for their cattle. https://t.co/9E5ZjyFI7T

Part 1 of the #RancherReliefPlan:

Opening up new markets to Montana producers and diversifying meat production by cutting the burdensome red tape preventing interstate commerce. https://t.co/77Pe3HEA2E

There's no easy way to put it—when it comes to the challenges of consolidation and the continued impacts of the COVID-19, Montana ranchers have been taking it in the shorts. The first 3 parts of my #RancherReliefPlan will bring critical support to cattle producers across Montana. https://t.co/7L66SUK7Dp

Americans should never have to choose between their health and exercising their right to vote. I’ll be joining @SenDuckworth, @RepJasonCrow and @amprog at 10am MT to discuss how expanding #VoteByMail will help protect veterans and their communities during this health crisis. https://t.co/JLfqCMmrRg

Going live on Facebook in a few moments to answer more of your COVID-19 questions. Join the conversation here:
https://t.co/Cm8bXfkBH5

Thanks to the folks that have submitted questions for this afternoon’s live Q&A. I’ll be addressing these and providing helpful resources for folks in need.

https://t.co/Ef8V4oB0sE

The Senate is back in session, and I want to take a few minutes to answer your questions, give you an update on what’s happening in DC, and let you know about helpful resources for folks back in the Treasure State. Join me tomorrow, May 13, at 4pm MT for a live Q&A.

Congratulations. https://t.co/KqIXwVOB0V

https://t.co/60VfrElYe9

To slow the spread of this virus, we've got to test, test, test. These funds will bring more personal protective gear, training, outreach, and expand testing capabilities to the folks in health centers across Montana working hard to keep us safe.
https://t.co/qS8vl3m8Yf

Despite the ongoing pandemic that has claimed the lives of thousands nationwide, this Administration continues to play politics with Americans’ health care. @TheJusticeDept MUST stop its efforts to repeal the ACA—lives are depending on it. https://t.co/J6EebOIqLO https://t.co/cE28VO6OVN

If we’re truly committed to “draining the swamp”, any nominee for Inspector General—especially those overseeing $2.2 trillion in taxpayer dollars—must commit to reporting any undue political influence. Glad to secure this commitment from Brian Miller in this week’s hearing. https://t.co/fh4vNu4qIJ

I hear about the challenges facing nurses every day—and I’m so grateful for the nurses leading on the front lines of this pandemic. They have saved countless lives through their dedication, sacrifice, and care. Thank you. #NationalNursesDay https://t.co/6qBJPW3WVn

Montana’s educators are the best in the business on any given day—but their ability to keep students engaged and adapt to distance learning has shown their ingenuity and dedication to serving our next generation of leaders. Happy #TeacherAppreciationDay to MT teachers everywhere. https://t.co/JJKW09tABa

The journey back to DC was a little longer than usual yesterday—but I made it. The Senate is back in session, and I’ll be fighting hard to deliver critical resources for folks back home in the Treasure State. Now let’s get to work. https://t.co/wtH8QbxEru

Today is the #NationalDayofAwareness for Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women and Girls. Today we shine a light on this crisis as we fight to end its devastation once and for all, and show all persons impacted they are #NotInvisible—not now, and not ever. https://t.co/0H31tPH7oC

Montanans support Montanans—that’s what makes our state the Last Best Place. Grateful to Baker, MT’s Sikorski & Sons farm for their generosity and kindness as they go the extra mile to put food on the table for folks in need. https://t.co/dQcikev3WZ

BREAKING: Nearly $200 million in relief will go to rural health care providers across Montana. Proud to secure these critical funds that will help rural hospitals and clinics keep their doors open and continue serving our communities. Read more here: https://t.co/xDdzu4hWdI

Less than half of Montanans have responded to the Census, putting critical investments into our state on the line. We can do better—fill out your form today: https://t.co/2nJGgtFwL4 https://t.co/Xfl4C4MPZo

As schools across the state closed, MT’s school nutrition teams made sure families in need weren’t left behind. Their hard work has provided thousands of MT students with nutritious meals throughout this pandemic. Proud for their service today on #SchoolLunchHeroDay and beyond.

To get back to normal, we’ve got to ensure Montana has the testing and supplies necessary to slow the spread of the virus and keep folks healthy. That’s why I’m backing the Medical Supply Transparency and Delivery Act—to get resources quickly to where they’re needed most. https://t.co/gHQWBCPxVk

Grateful to this Montana company for supporting the rural health providers combating this virus on the front lines—their donation of medical-grade gowns will help keep our health care workers safe. https://t.co/l8OvbuC8Gb

Market consolidation and price fixing puts rural America’s cow calf operators and small and medium size feeders at risk. Rural America feeds this nation—we've got to do all we can to keep our independent ranchers and feeders in business to protect our nation's food supply. https://t.co/miiNH0TKO0

.@SBAgov resumed accepting Paycheck Protection Program applications from participating lenders TODAY to get more relief to Montana small businesses in need. Learn more about SBA relief options here: https://t.co/IfT5T57I9I

Great to see the Last Best Place on #TheLastDance tonight. Just in time for planting season.

Before COVID-19 began impacting food production, consolidation in the cattle market had long been threatening the livelihood of independent ranchers. Rural America needs a long term solution for this critical issue—our nation's food security depends on it. https://t.co/UIKcbGu8AU

As folks in rural areas struggle to stay connected during this crisis, it's critical we address our country’s digital divide. Protecting folks on the front lines is a national responsibility. The federal government must support the states activating Guardsmen and women to fight the COVID-19 pandemic, and provide these folks with the benefits, health care, and protections they deserve. https://t.co/eMeU3ySwnI

Congratulations to Bigfork's Colten and Ryan, who have received the 2020 President’s Environmental Youth Award for their innovative research project working to collect data on bat populations! Their leadership and drive has made a difference for Montana conservation. Way to go!

It’s #NationalLibraryWeek! Though we can’t visit our local public libraries in person, Montana’s librarians are hard at work to provide plenty of digital content for Montanans across our state. Visit your local library’s website to check out what you can check out today!

Sharla and I are spending our #EarthDay working on the farm. Here in Big Sandy and across our state, our Montana way of life is rooted in the land around us—and it’s up to us to care for that land responsibly. Wishing you and yours the best this #EarthDay. https://t.co/k02n4BMhyn

I fought hard to include expansions in eligibility for @SBAgov resources in today's bipartisan package to MT's family farms and ranches. These resources will help give these folks—the lifeblood of our state's agriculture—the certainty they need as we head into planting season.

I'm supporting the bipartisan interim coronavirus package which provides more relief to Montana's small businesses and critical resources to the frontline health care workers protecting our communities.
Congratulations to @montana_tech's Grace Ostermiller for her innovative research and good luck at this year's #POH2020 virtual poster session! https://t.co/OXW4KKLJVK

As Montana schools turn to online learning to reduce the spread of COVID-19, it’s more important than ever students in rural areas have reliable, high-speed internet. I'm working closely with the State Department, cruise operators, airlines and other agencies to ensure Montanans abroad can quickly and safely return to the US.

After 72 hours of bipartisan negotiations, the Senate passed the third Coronavirus relief package, the #CARESAct, delivering vital relief to Montana workers, small businesses, families, and hospitals.

Montanans should be worried about keeping their families healthy, not standing in line at the DMV to fill out government paperwork. The deadline to obtain a REAL ID to fly commercially has been delayed—helping folks remain in compliance with the law while keeping families safe.

Good news! The Norwegian Jewel cruise ship has safely docked in Hawaii and folks aboard—including 16 Montanans—are now headed home. I'll continue to work with the State Department, cruise operators, airlines and more to ensure Montanans abroad can safely return to the US.

Today marks the 10th anniversary of the Affordable Care Act. It’s now more important than ever that we continue to protect folks with preexisting conditions and build upon this landmark legislation that provides critical access to care for millions of Americans.

Montanans are working together to provide cutting-edge support and filling gaps in urgently-needed medical supplies. There’s no doubt their innovative technology to protect our health care workers will save lives.
https://t.co/zRFCeZTWvz

After stalling, HHS Secretary Azar finally released the critical funding Indian Country needs to combat COVID-19. While I'm relieved the funds were released, to say this delay was unacceptable would be a gross understatement. In a crisis like this, every second matters.

The last thing Montanans need to focus on during a public health crisis is filing forms with the IRS. Glad that Treasury Secretary Mnuchin answered my call to extend the filing deadline for taxpayers and businesses. Montanans will now have until July 15 to file without penalties.

Thanks to everyone for joining yesterday’s Facebook Live. Your input is critical as we’re working to secure vital resources for Montanans impacted by the COVID-19 outbreak. As promised, a list of resources available for folks in need can be found here: https://t.co/PKitloURgU
